original_title: And he knew that those who witnessed these things might be too stunned to speak
overview: Installation, 16mm projection, 3 seconds, continuous loop; 2k projection 17’ 56’’, loop; Framed baryta inkjet print 26x38cm  This installation deals with how the claim to an impossibility of ‘witnessing’ the Holocaust is still retained through political speech. With the recurrent rise of Nationalisms throughout the world we must ask ourselves why notions like ‘the unimaginable’ and ‘the unthinkable’ activated whenever a president speaks about warfare?
title: And he knew that those who witnessed these things might be too stunned to speak
